title: How to Wear a Dress Shirt with Jeans

steps.title: You can create classy looks by mixing and matching colors.
steps.content: You can create classy looks by mixing and matching colors. Wear black, navy, or gray dress shirts with white or light wash denim for a fun contrast. [1] X Research source If your shirt is sheer, throw on a nude tank top for extra coverage. Add a pop of color with some red pumps and a clutch. [2] X Expert Source Kathi Burns, CPO® Fashion Stylist Expert Interview. 31 December 2019. Or, keep it neutral with black dress shoes and a watch.

steps.title: Pale and pastel shirts look great contrasted with dark wash pants.
steps.content: Pale and pastel shirts look great contrasted with dark wash pants. Throw on your lightest dress shirts and add a pair of dark wash jeans for a cool, suave look. [3] X Research source You could also mix it up with a pair of black jeans. Dark wash denim looks great with brown shoes and handbags.

steps.title: This everyday look can be worn almost anywhere.
steps.content: This everyday look can be worn almost anywhere. Throw on a solid-colored or graphic T-shirt, then layer your dress shirt on top without doing up the buttons. [4] X Expert Source Kathi Burns, CPO® Fashion Stylist Expert Interview. 31 December 2019. Choose a light-wash jean for a daytime-casual look and dark-wash distressed jeans for nighttime. Roll up your sleeves just below the elbow to stay cool during the summer.

steps.title: If you’re heading somewhere a little fancy, don’t let your shirt tails fly.
steps.content: If you’re heading somewhere a little fancy, don’t let your shirt tails fly. Instead, tuck your dress shirt into your jeans for a chic and sophisticated outfit. [5] X Research source If a fully tucked shirt is a little much for you, try tucking just the front to define your waist. If you’re rocking an oversized dress shirt, gather the excess fabric and knot it at the front to show off your figure.

steps.title: Contrast the formality of your shirt with casual bottoms.
steps.content: Contrast the formality of your shirt with casual bottoms. Pick jeans that are ripped or distressed to look cool and casual every time. [6] X Expert Source Kathi Burns, CPO® Fashion Stylist Expert Interview. 31 December 2019. You can pair your look with sneakers or boots. Try tucking in your dress shirt for the ultimate cool outfit.

steps.title: If your dress shirt is feeling a little plain, grab a bright sweater.
steps.content: If your dress shirt is feeling a little plain, grab a bright sweater. Pull the collar of your shirt out on top of the sweater for a cute pop of color, then pair it with your favorite light or dark wash jeans. [7] X Research source If you’d like an even brighter pop of color, throw a tie on underneath your sweater, too. Pair your look with heels or dress shoes to look put-together.

steps.title: The right outerwear can transform your look for a night out.
steps.content: The right outerwear can transform your look for a night out. Throw on a fitted blazer before you hit the town for a cool yet sophisticated outfit, and pair it with dark wash jeans for a cohesive look. [8] X Research source If you want to get really fancy with it, add a tie or a pair of suspenders too. Finish off your look with a pair of dress shoes or high heels.

steps.title: This outfit is perfect for chilly winter days.
steps.content: This outfit is perfect for chilly winter days. Throw on an overcoat that hits about mid-thigh to look classy while bundling up. [9] X Research source Try pairing a dark overcoat, like black or gray, with dark wash jeans. Or, pair a light overcoat, like camel or tan, with light wash jeans. Finish off your look with dark dress shoes or ankle boots.

steps.title: You don’t always have to wear pants with your dress shirt!
steps.content: You don’t always have to wear pants with your dress shirt! Throw on a pair of jean shorts to stay cool and casual during the summer. [10] X Research source Leave 2 or 3 buttons open at the top for an ultra-cool outfit. Wear sandals during the day and heels for a night out.

steps.title: Dress shirts already look pretty formal on their own.
steps.content: Dress shirts already look pretty formal on their own. Stick to small watches, bracelets, necklaces, or studs to let your shirt and your jeans be the star of the show. [11] X Research source If you’re feeling fancy, you could also throw on a pair of suspenders or a tie with your dress shirt.
